name: The Opera Multiple Choice Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who is setting the group up with tickets to see the opera, "I Pagliacci"?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	Jerry doesn't like the idea of opera because he doesn't think that anyone sings, and he doesn't like the type of language they perform in.  Kramer continues to pressure Jerry into seeing the opera.

questions.text: What does Elaine call her boyfriend?
questions.explanation:
Joey.

	Jerry is excited to meet 'Joey', but little does he know, 'Joey' is actually Crazy Joe Davola.  Crazy Joe appeared a few episodes prior to "The Opera", and Jerry ended up ruining Joe's deal with NBC.  Now, Joe is trying to get his revenge.

questions.text: What does Elaine find in Joe Davola's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Pictures.

	Joe Davola has been taking pictures of Elaine and developing them in his darkroom since he met her.  When Elaine enters the room, she realizes he's crazy because her pictures are plastered all over the walls, and he's acting weird.

questions.text: What does Elaine spray into Joe Davola's eyes?
questions.explanation:
Cherry Binaca.

	Elaine does this to escape from Crazy Joe Davola's apartment.  It's because of the cherry smell that Elaine is able to recognize Joe later in the episode when he dresses up as a clown.

questions.text: Who made the horrible toast at Bobby Layton's wedding?
questions.explanation:
George.

	Jerry states that the toast was so horrible that everyone was sitting in their seats, awestruck.  Apparently, George cursed a bit during the toast, and no one drank to it.  He was thrown out of the ceremony by the father of the bride.

questions.text: Why was Susan originally unable to attend the show?
questions.correct: She had to pick up a friend at the airport.
options: She had to visit her father in the hospital
She had to identify a body at the morgue
questions.explanation:
She had to pick up a friend at the airport.

	In the end, Susan does make it to the play because her friend's flight was delayed.  George wonders why she didn't pay for her opera ticket when she wasn't going to come, and he gets into a conversation about how he wishes women should at least attempt to pay for things when a man is around.

questions.text: How many tickets are scalped by the end of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Two & 2.

	Kramer and George attempt to sell Susan and Joe Davola's tickets at a higher price and they have a horrible time doing so.  Meanwhile, Crazy Joe Davola is on his way to the opera wearing a full clown costume.  Kramer sells one ticket to Joe, and George also sells his.

Clowns.

	Because of his fear, Kramer ends up giving his opera ticket to Crazy Joe Davola.  Kramer's fear ends up appearing in a future episode where he goes to the circus.

options: The body at the morgue was already identified
Visiting hours at the hospital were changed
questions.explanation:
Her plane landed elsewhere.

	Since the plane was forced to land, Susan was able to rush to the opera in time to see George selling his ticket to a man outside the theater.  George ends up not seeing the play, but Susan still attends the show.

questions.text: Elaine is the only one from the group actually watching the play in the end.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Jerry and Elaine race to their seats to escape Crazy Joe Davola, but they soon realize that Kramer gave a ticket to him.  Kramer also attends the show, and Susan also watches the play, but she's alone since George gave up his ticket.
